statement.tex:
\text{Discuss the continuity of the function\\ f, where f is defined by}\\
f(x) =\begin{cases} 2x, & if &x \lt 0\\ 0, &if &0\leq x \leq 1\\ 4x, & if &x \gt 1\\ \end{cases}

step.reason: \text{For a function to be continuous at a\\ point it's limits on either sides should be\\ equal to the value of f(x) at that point.}\\

step.tex: f(x) \text{ is a straight line for }x\ne 1,0.\\ \text{Hence, it is continuous for all }x\neq 1,0.\\ \text{But we need to check for continuity \\ at x=1,0.}
step.reason: \text{Since, at x=1,0 the definition of the\\ function changes. So, x=1,0 are the\\ only problem points.hence, we need\\ to check continuity at x=1,0.}

step.tex:
\lim_{x\to 0^-}f(x) = \lim_{x\to 0^-} (2x) = 0\\ \lim_{x\to 0^+}f(x) = 0 \\ f(0) = 0\\
\lim_{x\to 1^-}f(x) = 0\\ \lim_{x\to 1^+}f(x) = \lim_{x\to 1^+} (4x) =4 \\ f(1)= 0\\
\\ \text{Hence, f(x) is discontinuous at x=1.}\\
step.reason: \text{Since,f(x) is continuous at }x \neq 1,0\\ \therefore \text{x=1 is the only point of discontinuity}\\

choices.tex: \text{x=0 is the only point of discontinuity}
\text{x=1 is the only point of discontinuity}
